meanings.definition: A floating structure used to support a bridge or other weight.
meanings.sent1: The pontons kept the bridge afloat during the flood.
meanings.sent2: The workers secured the pontons to create a stable foundation for the bridge.
meanings.sent3: The playful ducks used the pontons as a resting spot in the pond.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like pontons, providing support for the project to move forward.
meanings.sent5: The colorful pontons bobbed gently on the water, reflecting the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A type of boat or vessel used for transportation.
meanings.sent1: The fishermen relied on their trusty pontons to navigate the river.
meanings.sent2: Tourists enjoyed a leisurely ride on the pontons along the scenic canal.
meanings.sent3: The pontons lined up neatly at the dock, ready for the next voyage.
meanings.sent4: In her dream, the pontons transformed into magical vessels sailing through the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The pontons glided smoothly across the water, carrying passengers to their destination.

meanings.definition: A type of military bridge made of floating sections.
meanings.sent1: The army swiftly assembled the pontons to cross the river under enemy fire.
meanings.sent2: The pontons provided a crucial link for the troops to advance across the water.
meanings.sent3: During the training exercise, the soldiers raced to deploy the pontons in record time.
meanings.sent4: The pontons acted as a lifeline, connecting the separated units on either side of the river.
meanings.sent5: The general praised the engineers for their innovative design of the pontons, ensuring a successful crossing.
